alphabetsoup.simulators.simpleexample
Class BucketbotManagerExample

java.lang.Object
  alphabetsoup.simulators.simpleexample.BucketbotManagerExample
All Implemented Interfaces:
Updateable
public class BucketbotManagerExample
extends java.lang.Object
implements Updateable

BucketbotGlobalResources implements a basic Bucketbot manager that uses basic queues of tasks to dispense jobs to bucketbots.

Author:
Chris Hazard

getNextEventTime

public double getNextEventTime(double cur_time)
Description copied from interface: Updateable
Gets the time of the earliest scheduled or possible event

Specified by:
getNextEventTime in interface Updateable
Parameters:
cur_time - the current system time
Returns:
the absolute time of the soonest possible event. Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY is valid return value if no events are scheduled, and no known collisions or pending events are known to happen.

requestNewTask

public void requestNewTask(Bucketbot r)
Bucketbots should call requestNewTask when they are idle and have no tasks

Parameters:

taskComplete

public void taskComplete(Bucketbot r,
                         BucketbotTask t)
Bucketbots should call taskComplete when an assigned task has been completed

Parameters:
r - Bucketbot which has completed a task
t - task which was completed -implementations may use any object types as a task

public void taskAborted(Bucketbot r,

Parameters:
r - Bucketbot which has aborted a task
